column7: Bushy and rocky places on calcareous soils[50].
column16: Iberis umbellata is a ANNUAL growing to 0.3 m (1ft) by 0.2 m (0ft 8in) at a fast rate. It is not frost tender.  It is in flower from May to September. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Bees, Lepidoptera (Moths & Butterflies). It is noted for attracting wildlife.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils, prefers  well-drained soil and can grow in nutritionally poor soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils and can grow in very alkaline soils. It cannot grow in the shade. It prefers dry or  moist soil.
column18: Cultivated Beds; East Wall. In. South Wall. In. West Wall. In.

column25: Easily grown in a good, well-drained ordinary garden soil in a sunny position[1]. Prefers a calcareous soil but tolerates mildly acid soils[1]. Succeeds in poor soils[200] and on dry walls[1]. A very ornamental plant[1]. A fast-growing plant[188]. Do not grow the plants too close together[1]. A good butterfly, moth and bee plant[30, 108].
column26: Seed - sow spring in situ for summer flowering or late summer in situ for a spring flowering[200]. The seed germinates within 3 weeks.
